headline: Citigroup nears Mexican consumer bank spinoff, WSJ reports
summary: Citigroup is close to spinning off its Mexican consumer bank Banamex, an important part of CEO Jane Fraser's bank overhaul plan, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday. Citigroup did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.

raw.headline: Citigroup nears Mexican consumer bank spinoff, WSJ reports
raw.summary: Citigroup is close to spinning off its Mexican consumer bank Banamex, an important part of CEO Jane Fraser's bank overhaul plan, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday. Citigroup did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.

headline: A Simpler Citigroup Begins to Take Shape
summary: Citigroup  is nearing an important milestone in efforts to spin off its Mexican consumer bank, an important part of chief executive  Jane Fraser’s  turnaround strategy.  The bank said it would complete a split next week of the systems that underpin Banamex from the rest of its operations in Mexico.  Citi plans to unload a slice of its stake through an initial public offering, then continue to sell the rest of its holdings over time.
